meanings.definition: Not existing in or derived from nature.
meanings.sent1: The robot's shiny, nonnatural skin caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The colorful, nonnatural lights of the amusement park lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The nonnatural glow of the alien's spaceship made it look like a giant firefly.
meanings.sent4: Her nonnatural talent for mimicry amazed the audience.
meanings.sent5: The eerie, nonnatural silence of the abandoned house sent shivers down her spine.

meanings.definition: Not conforming to the usual or expected patterns of nature.
meanings.sent1: The magician's nonnatural ability to make objects disappear left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent2: The nonnatural behavior of the talking animals in the story captivated the children.
meanings.sent3: The nonnatural speed at which the snail crossed the finish line surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her nonnatural sense of humor always brought a smile to people's faces.
meanings.sent5: The nonnatural beauty of the glowing mushrooms in the forest was like something out of a fairy tale.
